description: Front abdominal muscles, often referred to as abs, which help with trunk flexion and rotation.
Muscles on the sides of the abdomen that help with trunk rotation and lateral flexion.
Muscles on the front side of the forearm responsible for wrist and finger movements.
Front upper arm muscles responsible for elbow flexion and forearm supination.
Muscles surrounding the shoulder joint, including the deltoids and rotator cuff muscles.
Trapezius muscles located on the upper back and neck region, responsible for shoulder elevation and scapular movement.
Major chest muscles, including the pectoralis major and minor, responsible for arm adduction and shoulder flexion.
Front thigh muscles, including the quadriceps femoris group, responsible for knee extension and hip flexion.
Muscles located in the back of the lower leg, including the gastrocnemius and soleus, responsible for ankle plantar flexion.
